Class Antics

java.lang.Object
Antics
public class Antics extends Object
The Antics class provides a simple console-based menu that allows the user to perform various string operations.

Menu options include:

  • Checking if a string is a palindrome
  • Checking if a string is abecedarian
  • Checking if a string is a pangram
  • Capitalizing only the first letter of a string
The program continues to run until the user chooses to quit.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The entry point of the program. Displays a menu to the user, accepts input, and calls the appropriate string processing methods based on the user's choice.
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used)

    • isPalindrome

      public static boolean isPalindrome(String input)
      Says whether a given string is a palindrome.
      Parameters:
      input - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string is a palindrome; false otherwise

    • isAbecedarian

      public static boolean isAbecedarian(String input)
      Says whether a given string is abecedarian. A string is abecedarian if its letters appear in alphabetical order.
      Parameters:
      input - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string is abecedarian; false otherwise

    • isPangram

      public static boolean isPangram(String input)
      Says whether a given string is a pangram. A pangram contains every letter of the English alphabet at least once.
      Parameters:
      input - the string to check
      Returns:
      true if the string is a pangram; false otherwise

    • capitalizeFirstLetter

      public static String capitalizeFirstLetter(String input)
      Capitalizes only the first letter of the given string. If the string is null or empty, it is returned unchanged.
      Parameters:
      input - the string to capitalize
      Returns:
      the input string with its first letter capitalized
